com.example.jacob.mybrary

Class DataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.jacob.mybrary.DataManager

  • public class DataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This data management abstraction offers a simplified way of retrieving data. The data may either be remote or cached locally. (Sample partial match query: "{\"query\":{\"query_string\":{\"analyze_wildcard\":true,\"default_field\":\"name\",\"query\":\"Vic*\"}}}") Created by Dominic on 2015-11-04.

      • storeBook

        public java.lang.Boolean storeBook(Book book)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Stores a book on the server and caches it for later if there's no network connectivity.
        Parameters:
        book - The book to be stored
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether the book was stored on the server or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurred during communication.

      • removeBook

        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of the book to be removed.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether the request was successful or not.

      • retrieveBook

        public Book retrieveBook(java.lang.String id)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         org.json.JSONException
        Retrieves a stored book from the server or locally if there is no connection.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of the book to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Returns the Book object stored on the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurred during communication.
        org.json.JSONException - Thrown if the JSON was malformed (Possibly if an older version of an object is retrieved).
